title: Maybe Ekko's nerfs were a bit harsh

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Ekko when played Middle. Statistics include Ekko's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Ekko Middle is Strong or Weak Against.

body:
If players with 125+ games with Ekko only have a 41.82% winrate in platinum+, then maybe Ekko sucks balls right now.

EDIT: winrates for master+ according to Lolking http://www.lolking.net/champions/ekko&region=all&map=sr&queue=1x1&league=challenger#statistics

He has a few good days where his winrate is above 50%, but most days it sits around 40% give or take 5%.

replies.body:
**Any teleporting champion is dirty**. The fact that Flash is used by every player in every match simply says teleporting is a most powerful ability. This incredibly useful game-changing ability is so engraved into this game is maybe why they do not address it.

Whether buffed or nerfed, teleporting can exploit any favorable moment and there's always a favorable moment to pounce on enemy or escape from enemy.

_"So who else has dirty **intolerable** distance-closing?"_
(Intolerable because lack visual prompt and/or apply additional crowd-control)

* EZREAL (instant tp, excess dmg hard to dodge)
 * EZREAL, EZREAL and EZREAL
* ZED (instant cast & escape)
* XIN ZHAO (instant cast and cc)
* IRELIA (instant cast and cc)
* KATARINA (instant results)
* maybe DIANA
* RIVEN (distance-close with excess)
* LEBLANC (tp everywhere)
* KASSADIN (instant and damage)
* BLITZCRANK (instant cast and cc)
* ALISTAR (instant close distance and cc)
* MALPHITE (ult; instant cast and cc)
* LEONA (cast, close and cc)
* FIDDLESTICKS (huge distance-close; instant aoe w/ cc option)
*  FIZZ (slimey)
* and EKKO (fk this lil bish)  ...

_"But they nerfed and etc, etc!"_
So what? That doesn't excuse their dirty kit.

I think that he has some small buffs on the PBE, currently.

Edit: found it

>Ekko
Timewinder (Q) mana cost lowered to 50/60/70/80/90 from 60/70/80/90/100
Phase Dive (E) cooldown lowered to 13/11.5/10/8.5/7 from 15/13/11/9/7
Or maybe they weren't enough. Just Ekko players being obnoxious loses them games.
If people with 125+ games with the champion have 45% winrate then maybe there is a problem.

> [{quoted}](name=Jarrito232,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JbfRBpf3,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2015-07-21T01:13:26.367+0000)
>
> If people with 125+ games with the champion have 45% winrate then maybe there is a problem.

Or it's that they still haven't figured out fully what he's able to do..And the fact that he's a soft-mage revolving around quickly nuking a target rather than sustained-damage, it's hard to carry when your potential damage relies on you having to be around long-enough to get 3-damaging skills out. 45% winrate seems pretty logical in my view for what his kit provides..Players just need MORE experience with him (yes, more than 125 battles). It's strange to say that, but that's how I see it.

Other champions with a high skill roof winrates at 125+ games.

Elise- 51.06%
Riven- 55.34%
Yasuo- 53.45%
Cassiopeia- 49.36%
Lee SIn- 48.44%
Zed- 53.69%
Vayne- 52.77%
Kassadin- 47.26%
LeBlanc- 49.75%
Azir- 53.8%

Even Kassadin(who has notoriety as a gutted champion) has a higher winrate at the 125+ game level. Elise and Azir as well. Ekko has been out for ample time for people to get the hang of him. (unless he is LoL's hardest champion ever made, which is currently considered Lee Sin.) I think that there is a lot of bias against Ekko because of his release strength and the fact that he is an assassin.

People do not want Ekko to be strong because he's a high utility assassin. Assassins are highly mobile, squishy, and oppressive, so they don't normally have safety or escapes. *{{champion:105}} 

He's broken by design because those things should not go together.

Most assassins have some sort of escape tool. (Rengar has the least amount of escape potential, but he is pretty mobile around bushes.) Ekko was designed to either stay ahead of the competition until he wins, or if that doesn't work provide CC for your team. He had too much damage on release, so he was like most assassins except with utility. I think his utility needs buffed a little because his damage is pretty low now.

Considering that Ekko's +125 game win rate is exactly equal to his average win rate, I'm going to say they didn't have a large enough sample size to calculate it, so they just left it with his normal. He is ranked 50/50 for average games played, so obviously his win rate should be just as low.

Na, I haven't played the champ lol. I don't agree with playing champs that are highly overloaded and still have more damage in their kit than Veigar.
no

I don't think anyone should ever be gutted, but I'm not going to lie, Ekko is one of those champions that shouldn't be good. His kit is so frustrating that if he is sitting at an 'even' power as everyone else, he is actually very far ahead. For further references, see;

Yasou
Kallista
Zed
Thresh

> Yasou
> Kallista

What part is frustrating? He has more counterplay than every single one of those champions. He probably has more than most of the game and is basically forced to wait for his opponents to fuck up. Every champion should be good. That's the point of balance...

> [{quoted}](name=TaIont,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JbfRBpf3,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-07-19T13:43:52.059+0000)
>
> What part is frustrating? He has more counterplay than every single one of those champions. He probably has more than most of the game and is basically forced to wait for his opponents to fuck up. Every champion should be good. That's the point of balance...

Most people complain about his W if i recall correctly. They could not accept the large shield + Stun it offered, regardless of how unreliable it actually was. They never accept someone hitting the Jackpot. (like when the ADC Crits 3 times in a row). Regardless though. His W does make a powerful zoning tool, so he doesn't exactly have to wait, for people to fuck up. 

It seems like they are nerfing his AoE damage. First they nerfed his Q damage, then they reduced the AoE on his Ult. This is quite fair for a Utility Assassin. Assassins in general should focus on their single target damage. If the nerfs did hit him too hard, they should put that power on his passives. 

Because his kit is, part unreliable, and part high skill, It's probably not fair to use Winrate as a the only metric for measuring a champions strength.
He is bad in mid, but better in other positions. He is in a much better place if you look at his jungle stats, and his 50+ games played top stats are insane.

I think this change to sheen items would help ekko alot: 
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/PNTMYiH1-sheen-to-also-proc-like-krug-buff

since he has some fairly lengthy cooldowns (before you level them up to 5 and if you don't have that much cdr) and tends to be all in when engaging and blows all his spells. unlike say evelyn who gets alot more out of sheen.

well, yes and no.
Since his basekit became weaker, he now is even more reliant on landing a good W stun or ult, which increases is skillfloor.
However, he still has a massive potential, and experienced players can still be insane with him.
It'S also important to note that mid is by far his weakest position, his winrates top and jungle look quite different.
also, the 125+ winrate doesn't show anything at this point, as very, very few players will have that much games with him atm, and thus champion.gg uses his average winrate here,as they lack samples to calculate a winrate for 125+ games.

the winrate around 50 games probaly tells more about experienced ekkos, and his winrates look different here(44%mid, 52%jungle, 70% top)
his only nerf should have been his passive damage nerf because it suddenly took 1/2 a squishy hp

> [{quoted}](name=ZeusHasRefresher,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JbfRBpf3,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-07-19T14:57:30.260+0000)
>
> his only nerf should have been his passive damage nerf because it suddenly took 1/2 a squishy hp

that's..One of the two only places his damage comes from. His ratios on his E are merely there to give bonus damage but more importantly for his engage potential/combinations with W. His theme revolves around landing 3 marking-abilities for a nuke, and starting/ending with his ultimate for a large nuke of damage. 

If anything needs to be nerfed on him (Which I can't viably find yet), it would MAYBE be the shield value on his W? The stun is what allows him to be competitive in engages, but the shield shouldn't be relied on most of the time..It's the stun that's game changing in most cases. but he's got plenty of counterplay. CC him when he's low and kill him, he can't ult. Pretty much the easiest way to handle him is with CC at the right time.
He has a 57% win rate in Master over the last 30 days and a 51% win rate in Challenger. So no, the nerfs were not harsh at all.
No, just no. Ekko is annoying and ridiculous in the right hands. He doesn't need buffs.
